tit.e: Ehomaki (maki-zushi, eating on the day of Setsubun)
tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。
tit.e: Ehomaki (maki-zushi, eating on the day of Setsubun)

sen.j: 恵方巻、恵方巻き（えほうまき）は、節分に食べると縁起が良いとされる巻き寿司またはそれを食べる近畿地方を中心とした風習である。
sen.e: Ehomaki (written as 恵方巻 or 恵方巻き) refers to the maki-zushi (sushi roll) eating which on the day of Setsubun (the traditional end of winter) is considered to bring good luck, or the custom centered around the Kinki region of eating the ehomaki.

Ehomaki (written as 恵方巻 or 恵方巻き) refers to the maki-zushi (sushi roll) eating which on the day of Setsubun (the traditional end of winter) is considered to bring good luck, or the custom centered around the Kinki region of eating the ehomaki.

Ehomaki (written as 恵方巻 or 恵方巻き) refers to the maki-zushi (sushi roll) eating which on the day of Setsubun (the traditional end of winter) is considered to bring good luck, or the custom centered around the Kinki region of eating the ehomaki.

sen.j: 「恵方寿司」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called "ehozushi".
It is also called 'ehozushi.'
sen.cmt: 引用符、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: It is also called 'ehozushi.'

sen.j: 節分の夜にその年の恵方に向かって目を閉じて一言も喋らず、願い事を思い浮かべながら太巻きをまるかじりするのが習わしとされている。
sen.e: According to the custom, one looks in the lucky direction of the year (according to the Chinese zodiac) with closed eyes, and silently bites into a thick sushi roll while thinking of his/her wish.
sen.cmt: 説明として【(according to the Chinese zodiac)】を追加しました。
sen.e: According to the custom, one looks in the lucky direction of the year (according to the Chinese zodiac) with closed eyes, and silently bites into a thick sushi roll while thinking of his or her wish.
sen.cmt: his/her→his or her と修正しました。
sen.e: According to the custom, one looks in the lucky direction of the year (according to the Chinese zodiac) with closed eyes, and silently bites into a thick sushi roll while thinking of his or her wish.

sen.j: 商売繁盛や無病息災を願ってのもので、七福神に因み、かんぴょう、キュウリ、シイタケ、 だし巻、うなぎ、でんぶ等七種類の具を入れて食べる。
sen.e: The custom reflects people's wish for prosperous trade and state of perfect health; ehomaki contains seven kinds of ingredients, such as gourd strip, cucumber, shiitake mushroom, rolled omelet made with soup stock, eel, and denbu (mashed and seasoned fish, flesh of whitefish and shrimp that has been boiled, shredded, parched, seasoned, and colored red) inside, by association with the Seven Deities of Good Luck.
sen.cmt: Webで確認し、【七福神に因み、かんぴょう、キュウリ、シイタケ、 だし巻、うなぎ、でんぶ等七種類の具を入れて食べる。】を追加しました。
sen.e: The custom reflects people's wish for prosperous trade and state of perfect health; ehomaki contains seven kinds of ingredients, such as gourd strip, cucumber, shiitake mushroom, rolled omelet made with soup stock, eel, and denbu (mashed and seasoned fish, flesh of whitefish and shrimp that has been boiled, shredded, parched, seasoned, and colored red) inside, to be associated with the Seven Deities of Good Luck.
sen.cmt: by association with→to be associated と修正しました。
sen.e: The custom reflects people's wish for prosperous trade and state of perfect health; ehomaki contains seven kinds of ingredients, such as gourd strip, cucumber, shiitake mushroom, rolled omelet made with soup stock, eel, and denbu (mashed and seasoned fish, flesh of whitefish and shrimp that has been boiled, shredded, parched, seasoned, and colored red) inside, to be associated with the Seven Deities of Good Luck.

sen.j: 恵方巻の起源はいくつもの説があり定かではない。
sen.e: There are many theories concerning the origin of ehomaki, and none is definite.
There are many theories concerning the origin of ehomaki, and none is definite.
There are many theories concerning the origin of ehomaki, and none is definite.

sen.j: その一つに下記のものがある。
sen.e: One of such theories is the following.
sen.cmt: 【下記のものがある】を追加しました。
sen.e: One of such theories is the following.
One of such theories is the following.

sen.j: 節分の日は暦の上で春を迎える立春の前日にあたるので、一年の災いを払うための厄落とし、年中行事として行われた。
sen.e: Since the day of Setsubun falls under the day before risshun (the first day of spring) of entering spring according to the calendar, the custom was done as an annual event of yakuotoshi (ceremony to drive away evil spirits) for driving away bad luck for the year.

Since the day of Setsubun falls under the day before risshun (the first day of spring) of entering spring according to the calendar, the custom was done as an annual event of yakuotoshi (ceremony to drive away evil spirits) for driving away bad luck for the year.

Since the day of Setsubun falls under the day before risshun (the first day of spring) of entering spring according to the calendar, the custom was done as an annual event of yakuotoshi (ceremony to drive away evil spirits) for driving away bad luck for the year.

sen.j: また豊臣秀吉の家臣・堀尾吉晴が偶々節分の前日に巻き寿司のような物を食べて出陣し、戦いに大勝利を収めたという故事を元にしているという説もある。
sen.e: Another theory is based on the historical event in which, on the day before the day of Setsubun, a vassal of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI named Yoshiharu HORIO happened to eat what looked like maki-zushi and departed for the front, and came off of a great victory in a battle.

Another theory is based on a historical event in which, on the day before the day of Setsubun, a vassal of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI named Yoshiharu HORIO happened to eat what looked like maki-zushi and departed for the front, and came off of a great victory in the battle.

Another theory is based on a historical event in which, on the day before the day of Setsubun, a vassal of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI named Yoshiharu HORIO happened to eat what looked like maki-zushi and departed for the front, and came off of a great victory in the battle.

sen.j: その他にも恵方巻の発祥地の候補には、和歌山県（紀伊国）、滋賀県（近江国）等があるがいずれも確かなものではない。
sen.e: Other places named as the birthplace of ehomaki include Wakayama Prefecture (Kii Province) and Shiga Prefecture (Omi Province), but neither is definite.
Other places named as the birthplace of ehomaki include Wakayama Prefecture (Kii Province) and Shiga Prefecture (Omi Province), but neither is definite.
Other places named as the birthplace of ehomaki include Wakayama Prefecture (Kii Province) and Shiga Prefecture (Omi Province), but neither is definite.

sen.j: 以後恵方巻の習慣は、昭和初期の大阪では船場の商人の間で行なわれていたようで節分の「丸かぶり（切り分けずに「丸ごとかじりつく」の意）ずし」の広告チラシも作成された。
sen.e: It seems that later, the custom of ehomaki was conducted among merchants in Senba, Osaka in the early part of Showa period; the publicity handout of "marukaburi zushi ("marukaburi" means "biting into the whole piece" without cutting it) for Setsubun was created.

It seems that later, the custom of ehomaki was conducted among merchants in Senba, Osaka in the early part of Showa period; the publicity leaflet of 'marukaburi zushi' ("marukaburi" means 'biting into the whole piece' without cutting it) for Setsubun was created.
sen.cmt: handout→leaflet,引用符をそれぞれ修正しました。
sen.e: It seems that later, the custom of ehomaki was conducted among merchants in Senba, Osaka in the early part of Showa period; the publicity leaflet of 'marukaburi zushi' ("marukaburi" means 'biting into the whole piece' without cutting it) for Setsubun was created.

sen.j: しかし、「一気に丸かぶりしなければいけない」ということは、海苔の販促として恵方巻を売り出した、「たこ昌」の代表取締役である山路昌彦の作り話とも言われる。
sen.e: However, it is also said that the tradition that ehomaki "must be eaten with one bite" was a story made up by Masahiko YAMAJI, the president of "Takomasa", who began selling ehomaki to promote the sale of nori (dried sheets of a type of red algae).

However, it is also said that the tradition that ehomaki 'must be eaten with one bite' was a story made up by Masahiko YAMAJI, the president of 'Takomasa,' who began selling ehomaki to promote the sale of nori (dried sheets of a type of red algae).
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を修正しました。引用符を修正しました。
sen.e: However, it is also said that the tradition that ehomaki 'must be eaten with one bite' was a story made up by Masahiko YAMAJI, the president of 'Takomasa,' who began selling ehomaki to promote the sale of nori (dried sheets of a type of red algae).

sen.j: 大阪での復活
sen.e: Revival in Osaka
Revival in Osaka
Revival in Osaka

sen.j: 戦後に一旦廃れたが、1973年から大阪海苔問屋協同組合が作製したポスターを寿司屋が共同で店頭に貼り出し、海苔を使用する巻き寿司販促キャンペーンとして広められた。
sen.e: Although the custom died out temporarily after the war, since 1973, posters created by Osaka Nori Wholesale Cooperative Association were jointly put up by sushi restaurants at their shops, spreading the campaign for sales promotion of maki-zushi which used nori.

Although the custom died out temporarily after the war, since 1973, posters created by Osaka Nori Wholesale Cooperative Association were jointly put up by sushi restaurants at their shops, spreading the campaign for sales promotion of maki-zushi which used nori.

Although the custom died out temporarily after the war, since 1973, posters created by Osaka Nori Wholesale Cooperative Association were jointly put up by sushi restaurants at their shops, spreading the campaign for sales promotion of maki-zushi which used nori.

sen.j: 翌1974年には大阪市で海苔店経営者等がオイルショック後の海苔の需要拡大を狙いとして節分のイベントで海苔巻きの早食い競争をはじめた。
sen.e: In 1974 the following year, owners of nori stores, etc. in Osaka, aiming to expand the demand for nori after the oil crisis of 1973, held a speed-eating contest of ehomaki at a Setsubun event.

In 1974 the following year, owners of nori stores, etc. in Osaka City, aiming to expand the demand for nori after the oil crisis of 1973, held a speed-eating contest of norimaki (vinegared rice rolled in dried nori [laver]) at a Setsubun event.
sen.cmt: City を補いました。ehomaki→norimaki (vinegared rice rolled in dried nori [laver]) と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1974 the following year, owners of nori stores, etc. in Osaka City, aiming to expand the demand for nori after the oil crisis of 1973, held a speed-eating contest of norimaki (vinegared rice rolled in dried nori [laver]) at a Setsubun event.

sen.j: 1977年に大阪海苔問屋協同組合が道頓堀で行った海苔の販売促進行事を行った。
sen.e: In 1977, Osaka Nori Wholesale Cooperative Association organized a sales promotion event for nori in Dotonbori (a geographical name).
In 1977, Osaka Nori Wholesale Cooperative Association organized a sales promotion event for nori in Dotonbori (a geographical name).
In 1977, Osaka Nori Wholesale Cooperative Association organized a sales promotion event for nori in Dotonbori (a geographical name).

sen.j: 以上などが契機となって、復活することとなった。
sen.e: Circumstances such as those described above led to the revival of ehomaki.
Circumstances such as those described above led to the revival of ehomaki.
Circumstances such as those described above led to the revival of ehomaki.

sen.j: 道頓堀で行われた販売促進イベントがマスコミに取り上げられて関西に広がり、その後はコンビニで販売されるようになって全国で販売促進キャンペーンが行われている。
sen.e: Since the sales promotion event held in Dotonbori was picked up by the media, it spread to the Kansai region, and later ehomaki came to be sold at convenient stores; as such, the sales promotion campaign for ehomaki came to be held across the country.

Since the sales promotion event held in Dotonbori was picked up by the media, it spread to the Kansai region, and later ehomaki came to be sold at convenient stores; as such, the sales promotion campaign for ehomaki came to be held across the country.

Since the sales promotion event held in Dotonbori was picked up by the media, it spread to the Kansai region, and later ehomaki came to be sold at convenient stores; as such, the sales promotion campaign for ehomaki came to be held across the country.

sen.j: 商業的に売り上げの落ちる1月後半～2月初旬の販売イベントとして、主にコンビニエンスストアを中心として各地で展開。
sen.e: As a sales event from late January until early February, which is commercially a period of depressed sales, sale of ehomaki expanded with a central focus on mostly convenience stores.
As a sales event from late January until early February, which is commercially a period of depressed sales, sale of ehomaki expanded with a central focus on mostly convenience stores.
As a sales event from late January until early February, which is commercially a period of depressed sales, sale of ehomaki expanded with a central focus on mostly convenience stores.

sen.j: ファミリーマートが先駆けであり、1983年に大阪府と兵庫県で販売が開始された。
sen.e: As a pioneering company, Family Mart started selling ehomaki in Osaka and Hyogo Prefecture in 1983.
As a pioneer, Family Mart started selling ehomaki in Osaka prefecture and Hyogo Prefecture in 1983.
sen.cmt: a pioneering company→a pioneer と修正しました。Prefecture を補いました。
sen.e: As a pioneer, Family Mart started selling ehomaki in Osaka prefecture and Hyogo Prefecture in 1983.

sen.j: 1989年には広島県のセブン-イレブンも販売を開始し、その後販売エリアを拡大し、1998年に全国展開をしたことで急速に普及した。
sen.e: In 1989, 7-Eleven, Inc. in Hiroshima Prefecture started selling ehomaki, and later expanded its sales area; as the result of sales expansion to throughout all of Japan, ehomaki rapidly became popular.
In 1989, 7-Eleven, Inc. in Hiroshima Prefecture started selling ehomaki, and later expanded its sales area; as the result of sales expansion to throughout Japan, ehomaki rapidly became popular.
sen.cmt: all of を削除しました。
sen.e: In 1989, 7-Eleven, Inc. in Hiroshima Prefecture started selling ehomaki, and later expanded its sales area; as the result of sales expansion to throughout Japan, ehomaki rapidly became popular.

sen.j: 2007年頃からは便乗する形でロールケーキを「恵方巻き（恵方ロール）」として販売するケースまでも出てきている。
sen.e: From around 2007, there was even the case of selling a Swiss roll as "ehomaki (or "eho roll")", by taking advantage of real ehomaki.
From around 2007, there was even the case of selling a Swiss roll as 'ehomaki [eho roll],' by taking advantage of real ehomaki.
sen.cmt: 引用符、クオーツ内のカッコ等を修正しました。
sen.e: From around 2007, there was even the case of selling a Swiss roll as 'ehomaki [eho roll],' by taking advantage of real ehomaki.

sen.j: また、2007年1月にはセブン-イレブンから「丸かぶりロールケーキ」が発売されている。
sen.e: Furthermore, in January of 2007, 7-Eleven, Inc. sold a Swiss roll called "marukaburi Swiss roll".
Furthermore, in January of 2007, 7-Eleven, Inc. sold a Swiss roll called "marukaburi Swiss roll."
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, in January of 2007, 7-Eleven, Inc. sold a Swiss roll called "marukaburi Swiss roll."

sen.j: 1990年代以降、毎年1月初頭から節分期間まで、全国でテレビCMを放映したり、スーパーマーケットが販促活動を行うなどPRをおこなっている。
sen.e: Since the 1990's, from the beginning of January until the period of Setsubun every year, PR events, such as broadcast of TV commercial nationwide and sales promotion activities by supermarkets, were implemented.

Since the 1990's, from the beginning of January until the period of Setsubun every year, PR events, such as broadcast of TV commercial nationwide and sales promotion activities by supermarkets, are implemented.

Since the 1990's, from the beginning of January until the period of Setsubun every year, PR events, such as broadcast of TV commercial nationwide and sales promotion activities by supermarkets, are implemented.

sen.j: 愛知県を本社所在地とするミツカンが行った調査では、恵方巻の認知度の全国平均は2002年の時点で53%だったが、2006年には92.5%にまで上昇し、「実際に食べた」と答えた人の全国平均も2006年の時点で54.9%に達している。
sen.e: According to the survey conducted by Mizkan Group Corporation which has its head office in Aichi Prefecture, the national average of awareness of ehomaki was 53% in 2002, whereas it increased to 92.5% in 2006, and the national average of respondents who "actually ate" ehomaki reached 54.9% in 2006.

According to the survey conducted by Mizkan Group Corporation which has its head office in Aichi Prefecture, the national average of awareness of ehomaki was 53% in 2002, whereas it increased to 92.5% in 2006, and the national average of respondents who 'actually ate' ehomaki reached 54.9% in 2006.
sen.cmt: 引用符を修正しました。
sen.e: According to the survey conducted by Mizkan Group Corporation which has its head office in Aichi Prefecture, the national average of awareness of ehomaki was 53% in 2002, whereas it increased to 92.5% in 2006, and the national average of respondents who 'actually ate' ehomaki reached 54.9% in 2006.

sen.j: その一方で、実際に恵方巻を食べるかについては地域差も生じている。
sen.e: At the same time, regional difference can also be observed regarding whether or not to actually eat ehomaki.
At the same time, regional difference can also be observed regarding whether or not to actually eat ehomaki.
At the same time, regional difference can also be observed regarding whether or not to actually eat ehomaki.

sen.j: 近年のこのイベントの全国への広まり方はバレンタインデー・ホワイトデー・オレンジデーの菓子贈答と同じく、海苔業界やコンビニ業界など関係業界の主導のもと販売促進を目的とした傾向があり、本来の太巻きではなく「海鮮巻き版」「ロールケーキ版」なども販売されている。
sen.e: The spread of this event nationwide in recent years has the tendency of aiming at sales promotion under the leadership of relevant industries such as nori industry and convenience store industry, as in the case of giving sweets on Valentine's Day, White Day, and Orange Day; as such, "seafood sushi roll version" and "Swiss roll version", which are not the original thick sushi roll, are also being sold.

The spread of this event nationwide in recent years has the tendency of aiming at sales promotion under the leadership of relevant industries such as nori industry and convenience store industry, as in the case of giving sweets on Valentine's Day, White Day, and Orange Day; as such, 'seafood sushi roll version' and 'Swiss roll version,' which are not the traditional thick sushi roll, are also being sold.
sen.cmt: 引用符、カンマの位置を修正しました。original→traditional と修正しました。
sen.e: The spread of this event nationwide in recent years has the tendency of aiming at sales promotion under the leadership of relevant industries such as nori industry and convenience store industry, as in the case of giving sweets on Valentine's Day, White Day, and Orange Day; as such, 'seafood sushi roll version' and 'Swiss roll version,' which are not the traditional thick sushi roll, are also being sold.
